![Clara Zetkin](data:image/png;base64,)

### 1857–1933

[Biography](https://www.marxists.org/glossary/people/z/e.htm#zetkin-clara)

Writings:

[Only in Conjunction With the Proletarian Woman Will Socialism Be Victorious](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1896/10/women.htm), October 1896  
   
[The Workers’ International Festival](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1899/05/festival.htm), May 1899  
   
[May Greetings from Stuttgart](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1900/05/stuttgart.htm), May 1900  
   
[Social-Democracy & Woman Suffrage](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1906/xx/womansuffrage.htm), 1906  
   
[For Adult Suffrage](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1909/05/suffrage.htm), May 1909  
   
[German Socialist Women’s Movement](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1909/10/09.htm), October 1909  
   
[A Greeting from Abroad](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1913/05/labourwoman.htm), May 1913  
   
[August Bebel Obituary](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1913/08/bebel.htm), August 1913  
   
[German Women to Their Sisters in Great Britain](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1913/12/sisters.htm), December 1913  
   
[The Duty of Working Women in War-Time](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1914/11/19.htm), November 1914  
   
[The Women of Germany to the Women of Great Britain](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1915/01/reply.htm), January 1915  
   
[Rosa Luxemburg](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1919/05/junius.htm) (intro to the Junius Pamphlet), May 1919  
   
[Karl Liebknecht](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1919/09/karl.htm), September 1919  
   
[Rosa Luxemburg](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1919/09/rosa.htm), September 1919  
   
[Hail to the Third Socialist International!](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1919/xx/hail.htm), 1919  
   
[In Defence of Rosa Luxemburg](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1919/xx/defencerosa.htm), 1919  
   
[Through Dictatorship to Democracy](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1919/xx/dictdem.htm), 1919  
   
[The Situation in Germany](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1920/xx/germany.htm), 1920  
   
[Lenin on the Women’s Question](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1920/lenin/zetkin1.htm)   
[A May-Day Message from Germany](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1920/04/29.htm)   
[Clara Zetkin in Moscow](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1920/11/letter-from-russia.htm)   
[Fraternal Greetings to the Communist Unity Convention](https://www.marxists.org/history/international/comintern/sections/britain/subject/unity_convention/zetkin.htm), 1920  
  

#### The following 6 documents in this section were translated by John Riddell from the original languages they were presented and transcribed at the [3rd Congress of the Comintern in 1921](https://www.marxists.org/history/international/comintern/3rd-congress/riddell-translations/index.htm).

[World Economic Crisis and the New Tasks of the Communist International](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1921/zetkin01.htm), June 24, 1921  
 [Speech in Discussion of Executive Committee Report](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1921/zetkin02.htm), June 27, 1921  
 [Speech in Discussion of Italian Question](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1921/zetkin03.htm), June 29, 1921  
 [Statement](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1921/zetkin04.htm), July 2, 1921  
 [Speech in Discussion of Tactics and Strategy](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1921/zetkin05.htm), July 2, 1921  
  
[Speech Report on Communist Women’s Movement](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1921/zetkin06.htm), July 8, 1921  
  

#### The following 3 documents in this section were translated by John Riddell from the original languages they were presented and transcribed at the [4th Congress of the Comintern in 1922](https://www.marxists.org/history/international/comintern/4th-congress/index.htm).

[Speech to Opening Session of the Fourth Congress of the Communist International](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1922/zetkin01.htm), November 5, 1922  
   
[Report on Five Years of the Russian Revolution](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1922/zetkin02.htm), November 13–14, 1922  
 [Alternative translation above speech](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1922/11/speech.htm) from International Press Correspondence  
   
[Report on Communist Work among Women](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1922/zetkin03.htm), November 27, 1922  
 [Extracts from alternative translation](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1922/ci/women.htm) from International Socialism  
  

[The International Communist Women’s Day](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1922/03/icwd.html), March 1922  
   
[The Communist Delegation to the Chairman of the Commission of Nine](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1922/05/comm9.html), May 1922  
   
[To Arthur Henderson and James Ramsay MacDonald!](https://www.marxists.org/archive/bukharin/works/1922/06/hend-macd.html) (with N. Bukharin, L.-O. Frossard & K. Radek), March 1922  
   
[The Struggle Against New Imperialistic Wars](https://www.marxists.org/history/international/comintern/sections/britain/periodicals/communist_review/1922/03/imp_wars.htm), 1922  
   
[Organising Working Women](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1922/ci/women.htm), 1922  
   
[The Russian Revolution & the Fourth Congress of the Comintern](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1922/ci/fourth_congress.htm), 1922  
   
[Open Letter to the London and Vienna Internationals and the Amsterdam Trade Union International](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1923/01/openletter.html), January 1923 (with Fritz Heckert, Walton Newbold & Karl Radek)  
   
[March 8 – The International Communist Women’s Day, 1923](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1923/03/march8.htm), March 1923  
   
[Fight Fascism!](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1923/03/fascism.htm), March 1923  
   
[International Committee of Action against War and Fascism](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1923/04/fascism.htm), April 5, 1923  
   
[Soviet Russia and the IWR](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1923/06/iwr.htm) (with Alfons Paquet), June 7, 1923  
   
[The Struggle Against Fascism](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1923/06/struggle-against-fascism.html), June 20, 1923, to the Third Plenum of the Executive Committee of the Communist International  
 [Alternative version](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1923/06/ecci-fascism.htm) in International Press Correspondence  
   
[Concluding Speech](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1923/06/ecci-fascism2.htm), June 21, 1923  
   
[Resolution on Fascism](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1923/06/fascism-report-comintern.htm), Communist International Executive Committee, June 23, 1923  
   
[The Enlarged Executive – Eleventh Day of Session](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1923/06/ecci-thanks.htm), June 23, 1923  
   
[Report of the Commission on the Women’s Question](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1923/06/ecci-women.htm), June 23, 1923  
   
[The Third Anniversary of the Kommunistka, The Women’s Organ of Soviet Russia’s Proletarian Revolution](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1923/06/kommunistka.htm), June 28, 1923  
   
[Help Reconstruction in Russia!](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1923/07/iwr.htm) (signed with 39 others), July 25, 1923  
   
[Fascism](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1923/08/fascism.htm), August 1923  
   
[From the International of Word to the International of Deed](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1924/xx/international.htm)   
[World Wide Field of Activity of the Comintern](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1924/xx/activity.htm)   
[To the Congress of the German Communist Party](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1924/xx/congress.htm)   
[The German October and the Path to Workers’ Power](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1924/Clara-Zetkin-at-5WC.pdf), 1924  
   
[Reminiscences of Lenin](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1924/reminiscences-of-lenin.htm), 1924  
   
[From My Memorandum Book](https://www.marxists.org/archive/zetkin/1925/lenin/zetkin2.htm) (An Interview with Lenin on the Woman Question)
